attributes.description:
This section provides Machine Learning (ML) powered visualizations to help assess compliance with CCI-004619, which focuses on identifying system vulnerabilities. These visualizations analyze anomaly scores from an ML job that detects an unusual number of new vulnerabilities being reported on hosts.

To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply a filter such as 'influencers.host.name: <your_component_name>' to isolate a specific system. The ML job learns the normal baseline of vulnerability reporting for your environment. A high anomaly score (e.g., 75 or above) could indicate a significant event, such as a new, widespread vulnerability being discovered by scanners, a scanner misconfiguration causing a flood of findings, or even a targeted attack exploiting a series of new vulnerabilities.
attributes.title: [CCI-004619] ML - New Vulnerabilities Health Status

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This table is your primary tool for deep-dive analysis and remediation. It provides the granular, actionable details needed to understand and address each specific vulnerability. Use this when you need to assign remediation tasks or investigate a particular finding.

**How an analyst can use it:** This table lists individual vulnerabilities with critical details. You can sort by any column, such as `vulnerability.severity`, to prioritize the most critical issues first. Use the search bar at the top of the table to find specific vulnerabilities by name (e.g., 'Log4Shell') or to filter for a particular host.
attributes.title: [CCI-004619] Detailed Vulnerability Listings

attributes.description: This visualization displays the health status for CCI-004619 by monitoring the highest anomaly scores from its associated Machine Learning job, which detects unusual numbers of new vulnerabilities. A high anomaly score indicates a significant deviation from the baseline, highlighting newly identified system vulnerabilities.
attributes.title: [CCI-004619] Identify Vulnerabilities ML

attributes.description:
This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-004619, which focuses on identifying vulnerabilities within the system. While Elastic does not perform vulnerability scanning, it excels at consolidating and analyzing data from dedicated scanners like Nessus or Qualys.

**How to Perform a Component-Level Compliance Assessment:**

1.  **Filter by Component:** Use the global filters at the top of the dashboard to focus on a specific system or component. For example, apply a filter like `host.name: "your_component_name"` or `host.ip: "192.168.1.10"`.
2.  **Analyze Vulnerability Posture:** With the component filter applied, observe the visualizations. Check the 'Vulnerability Breakdown by Severity' to understand the risk level. Identify critical or high-severity vulnerabilities that require immediate attention.
3.  **Prioritize Remediation:** Use the 'Detailed Vulnerability Listings' table to view specific vulnerabilities for the filtered component. Sort by severity to prioritize patching and remediation efforts.
4.  **Track Trends:** Observe the 'Vulnerability Discovery Trend' to see if new vulnerabilities are being introduced to the component over time, which could indicate issues with patching cycles or configuration management.
attributes.title: [CCI-004619] Identify Vulnerabilities
attributes.visState: {"title":"[CCI-004619] Identify Vulnerabilities","type":"markdown","aggs":[],"params":{"markdown":"# [CCI-004619] Identify Vulnerabilities\n\n### Centralize, visualize, and analyze vulnerability data from dedicated scanners.","fontSize":12,"openLinksInNewTab":false}}

attributes.description:
Why and When: This chart helps you identify which systems are the most vulnerable and therefore at the highest risk. Use this visualization to direct your patching and remediation teams to the assets that need the most immediate attention.

How an analyst can use it: The bar chart displays hosts with the highest counts of vulnerabilities. The tallest bars represent the systems that should be prioritized for remediation. You can click on any bar to filter the entire dashboard, allowing you to see the specific vulnerabilities for that single host.
attributes.title: [CCI-004619] Top 10 Vulnerable Hosts

attributes.description:
Why this visualization works: This table provides the essential context behind a vulnerability anomaly. It directly links a high anomaly score to the specific hosts affected and the names of the vulnerabilities involved, enabling a rapid assessment of the risk and the start of a remediation workflow.

How an analyst can use it: When an anomaly is detected, use this table to get immediate answers. Sort by 'anomaly_score' to see the most critical events. Identify which hosts ('influencers.host.name') are reporting an unusual number of new vulnerabilities and which vulnerabilities ('influencers.vulnerability.name') are most prevalent. This information is key to prioritizing patching and other mitigation efforts.
attributes.title: [CCI-004619] ML - Detailed New Vulnerability Anomalies
